all_stories.title: Align DEFAULT_PORT to 8422 across config_init.py and config.py
all_stories.description: The spec defines default_port=8422 for the async-crud-mcp target project, but both config_init.py and config.py use DEFAULT_PORT=8720. Update the default port constant and all references (docstrings, comments) to match the spec target.

acceptance_criteria.text: DEFAULT_PORT = 8422 in src/async_crud_mcp/daemon/config_init.py
DaemonConfig.port default = 8422 in src/async_crud_mcp/config.py
health.py port default updated from 8720 to 8422
Docstrings and inline comments referencing port 8720 updated to 8422
All existing tests pass after the port change

all_stories.title: Add --json flag to daemon status command and verify logs --follow
all_stories.description: The daemon_cmd.py status command is missing the --json output option required by spec (d20 AC-d20.4). Also verify and fix the logs command has all required options: --follow, --lines, --username, --user per spec d20 AC-d20.5.

acceptance_criteria.text: daemon status command has --json option that outputs raw JSON status
daemon logs command has --follow option for streaming log output
daemon logs command has --lines option to control number of lines
daemon logs command has --username option for per-user logs
daemon logs command has --user option (alias) for per-user logs
All commands confirmed to use config file mutation (ADR-003)

all_stories.title: Add --keep-config and --keep-logs flags to uninstall command
all_stories.description: The uninstall command in install_cmd.py uses --remove-config and --remove-logs flags but spec d23 requires both positive (--keep-config/--keep-logs) and negative (--remove-config/--remove-logs) flag variants. The install_cmd.quick_install should also set daemon.enabled=true after start.

acceptance_criteria.text: uninstall command has --keep-config flag (default behavior: keep config)
uninstall command has --remove-config flag (opt-in removal)
uninstall command has --keep-logs flag (default behavior: keep logs)
uninstall command has --remove-logs flag (opt-in removal)
Flags are mutually exclusive pairs per group

all_stories.title: Add HTTP /health endpoint to server.py
all_stories.description: The spec (d25 AC-d25.4) requires a proper HTTP /health endpoint returning status, version, and uptime. Currently server.py only exposes a health_tool() as an MCP tool. A dedicated HTTP /health route should be added so external health monitors and installers can check server health without MCP client setup.

acceptance_criteria.text: HTTP GET /health endpoint returns JSON with status, version, uptime fields
Health endpoint is accessible via plain HTTP (not MCP protocol)
Returns 200 OK for healthy status, 503 for unhealthy
scripts/test_server.py can check the HTTP /health endpoint

all_stories.title: Fix bootstrap_daemon configure_logging retention and add console enqueue
all_stories.description: configure_logging() in bootstrap_daemon.py uses retention=3 (int, 3 files) instead of '7 days' string retention per spec. The console handler is also missing enqueue=True for async safety (ADR-005).

acceptance_criteria.text: configure_logging() file handler uses retention='7 days' string format
configure_logging() console handler has enqueue=True for async safety
configure_logging() adds gz compression to file handler

all_stories.title: Verify and align installer.py pywin32 DLL config, venv creation, and CreateService flow
all_stories.description: scripts/installer.py needs deep verification that: (1) uv venv uses --managed-python flag (ADR-010), (2) pywin32 DLLs are configured for Windows Service context (GAP-5), (3) service installation calls the correct API chain. This is currently partial due to stdlib-only constraint and delegation pattern.

acceptance_criteria.text: installer.py creates venv using 'uv venv --managed-python' (ADR-010)
installer.py configures pywin32 DLLs via pywin32_postinstall.py or equivalent (GAP-5)
installer.py installs service by calling CLI bootstrap install (which uses CreateService API)
installer.py exits with 130 on keyboard interrupt/cancel
Interactive menu works without arguments: Install/Reinstall/Uninstall/Quit options

all_stories.title: Enhance README with CLI usage examples and two-layer architecture overview
all_stories.description: README.md (d87) is missing explicit CLI command usage examples and the two-layer architecture overview (daemon service + MCP server). The spec requires these sections for user onboarding.

acceptance_criteria.text: README contains Quick Install section showing setup.bat / setup.sh usage
README contains CLI usage examples for bootstrap, daemon, config subcommands
README contains Architecture section describing two-layer design (OS service + MCP server)
README describes per-user daemon model and multi-user support

All 16 ACs verified: APP_NAME='async-crud-mcp', all path functions present, XDG compliance, no auto-mkdir, service context detection, registry-based user profile lookup
All 7 ACs verified: get_active_sessions(), is_user_session_active(), Windows WTS, macOS /dev/console, Linux /run/user, ImportError handling, CLI __main__

All 7 ACs verified: ConfigWatcher with debounce_seconds, check_for_changes() returns True after debounce, ResilientConfigLoader generic class, ValidationError/JSONDecodeError fallback, _strip_comment_fields(), atomic_write_config(), has_fallback property
All 8 ACs verified: ShutdownHandler with SIGTERM/SIGINT, ValueError wrapping, add_callback(), __enter__/__exit__, graceful_stop(), shutdown_context(), AsyncShutdownHandler, SIGHUP on Unix

All 10 ACs verified: setup_logging() with console+file handlers, enqueue=True on all handlers, CONSOLE_FORMAT with colors, 10MB rotation + 7 days retention + gz compression, service_mode param, serialize_file option, diagnose=False for file, get_logger(), add_request_context(), no stdlib logging

AC verified: package initializer present

All 13 ACs verified: DaemonService extends ServiceFramework, _svc_name_='async-crud-mcp-daemon', GetAcceptedControls with SESSION_CHANGE, SvcOtherEx handles LOGON/LOGOFF, SERVICE_RUNNING report immediately, WindowsSelectorEventLoopPolicy+manual loop, SvcDoRun try/except+LogErrorMsg, install_service() direct CreateService API, PythonClass registry key, uninstall_service(), start_service() with timeout, stop_service(), ImportError on non-Windows

All major ACs verified: UserWorker dataclass with all fields, MultiUserDispatcher with workers dict, _configure_logging() with GAP-8 fallback chain, SYSTEM_ACCOUNTS frozenset, STARTUP_GRACE_SECONDS=15, platform ImportError check, await logger.complete() pattern present

All 5 ACs verified: get_active_sessions() with WTS API, is_user_session_active() case-insensitive, get_session_details() with session_id+state+state_code+is_active, handles WTSActive/Connected/Disconnected etc, ImportError on non-Windows

All 9 ACs verified: typer.Typer(name='async-crud-mcp'), bootstrap_app, daemon_app, config_app subcommand groups, setup command, quick-install command, uninstall command, version command with __version__, no_args_is_help=True

All 8 ACs verified: install with --force and --use-task-scheduler, uninstall with --username and --force, start with --username, stop with --username, status with --username and --json (visible in full file), list command, admin check, uses get_installer()
All 5 ACs verified: init with --force/--port/--no-interactive/--username, show with --username/--json, edit command, validate command, pydantic model validation via get_settings()
